intro: Spigelia caaguazuensis, commonly known as the Caaguazú spigelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its tubular, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Spigelia caaguazuensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
